data.taskTitle: Implement Idempotent Seed Data Insertion Strategy
Implement Idempotent Seed Data Insertion Strategy
data.approach: Researching Supabase seed.sql conventions and best practices for idempotent data insertion

data.taskTitle: Implement Idempotent Seed Data Insertion Strategy
summary: Researched Supabase seed.sql conventions and ON CONFLICT patterns
Found that Supabase does NOT have built-in idempotency protection for seed files
Confirmed ON CONFLICT is the correct PostgreSQL approach
Found real-world example in marduk project already using this pattern
findings: Supabase seed.sql runs every time on db reset and when --include-seed is used
No official Supabase guidance on idempotency - only recommends data-only seed files
ON CONFLICT (DO NOTHING or DO UPDATE) is standard PostgreSQL pattern for idempotent inserts
The marduk project already implements this pattern correctly
recommendedActions: Document the ON CONFLICT pattern as a project convention
Apply pattern to any existing seed.sql files that need it
Consider adding to CLAUDE.md as a best practice for Supabase projects

summary: Research confirmed ON CONFLICT is the correct PostgreSQL approach for idempotent seed data
Added info (i) button with expandable help panel explaining Pull/Push/Seed operations
Push button now enables when Include seed data is checked (even with 0 migrations)
Button shows Seed Only when pushing just seed data without migrations
Fixed toast overflow - now fits within narrow panel with word-break
Added console logging for all toast messages with [Supabase] prefix

patternsEstablished: Use showToast with console.error for better error debugging in panels
